tn.text: This is something to keep a person from moving freely.
Jeremiah was to send a set of fetters and yoke to each king listed.

tn.ref: by the hand of those kings' ambassadors
tn.text: Here "hand" stands for the agency of these ambassadors. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Give commands to them for their masters
tn.text: Jeremiah was instructed to give a set of chains and yoke to each ambassador and a message for each king regarding the chains and yoke.

tn.ref: by my great strength and my raised arm
tn.text: The phrase "raised arm" refers to great power and intensifies the first phrase. AT: "by my very great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: I give it to anyone who is right in my eyes
tn.text: "I give it to anyone I want to."
will become strong and defeat Babylon.

tn.ref: that does not put his neck into the yoke of the king
tn.text: Those that do not swear allegiance to the king of Nebuchadnezzar and pay tribute or taxes to the king.
This phrase refers to Nebuchadnezzar and his armies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "This is what Yahweh says will happen"
Yahweh continues to speak through Jeremiah to the people of Judah
A soothsayer is someone who makes predictions about the future.

tn.ref: But the nation that places its neck into the yoke of the king
tn.text: AT: "But the nation who serves the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
This means to prepare and use land to grow food crops
AT: "make Babylon their home"
Yahweh continues to speak through Jeremiah to the king of Judah.

tn.ref: Place your necks into the yoke of the king of Babylon
tn.text: God is requiring Judah to submit and serve Babylon as their king.

tn.ref: Why will you die—you and your people—by the sword, famine, and plague, just as I have declared about the nation that refuses to serve the king of Babylon?
tn.text: AT: "You will die, you and your people, by the sword, famine, and plague, just as I have declared, if you do not serve the king of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Yahweh continues to speak through Jeremiah to the king and people of Judah.

tn.ref: Do not listen to the words
tn.text: Yahweh is warning the people about all the false prophets that He did not send that are lying to them.

tn.ref: For I have not sent them out
tn.text: "For I have not sent them"
This phrase means speaking with Yahweh's power and authority or as his representative. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"I will send you away from your home country"
Jeremiah continues to speak the words of Yahweh.

tn.ref: The objects belonging to Yahweh's house are being returned from Babylon now!
tn.text: "People from Babylon are bringing back all the gold items that they took from Yahweh's temple!"

tn.ref: Why should this city become a ruin?
tn.text: "This entire city will be destroyed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
If what they speak is true, then they should be praying that my words do not come to pass and that the temple objects and leaders remain in Jerusalem.
Jeremiah continues to bring the message of Yahweh.

tn.ref: the pillars, the sea, and the base
tn.text: These were objects that were in the temple. The "sea," was a molten bronze basin.
The Hebrew text has "Jeconiah," which is a variation of the name "Jehoiachin." Many modern versions have "Jehoiachin" in order to make it clear that the same king is being referred to.
Jeremiah continues to speak the words of Yahweh.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
